description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fnma0","text":"Presented herein is a protocol for the extraction and quantification of bulk RNA and DNA from microalgae, adapted from the methodology outlined by Berdalet et al. (2005). RNA and DNA are extracted from microalgae samples and quantified using the fluorochrome SYBR Green II. To ensure accuracy, the concentrations of RNA and DNA standards are determined via absorbance measurements at 260 nm and 320 nm. This additional step aids in maintaining the consistency of the standard curve coefficients (i.e., the slope). The method demonstrates a sensitivity range of approximately 20-700 ng/ml for RNA and 10-700 ng/ml for DNA in the assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ze0bc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lpm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d8o7l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ja2f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cmqtn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6htld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42tqi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbf70","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1prc3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bekr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvoap","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"authors":"Berdalet E, Roldán C, Olivar MP, Lysnes K","can_edit":1,"date":null,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.3989/scimar.2005.69n11","guid":"495E47CF341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","journal":"Scientia Marina","title":"Quantifying RNA and DNA in planktonic organisms with SYBR Green II and nucleases. guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"54clu","text":"(1) Estimation of RNA/DNA in the collected microalgae samples:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lt5e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tng0","text":"L-LOD for RNA and DNA is 20 and 10 ng/mL, respectively. Common dilution from sample collected on the filter to assay is 1/40. The minimum RNA and DNA per filter requires to be no less than 1 and 0.5 ug/filter, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1n6c6","text":"Under replete condition, RNA and DNA is about 5.7% and 1% in total dry mass, while Chl-a is bout 1.1% in total dry mass. Therefore, RNA_ug/L = Chl-a_ug/L X (5.7/1.1), DNA_ug/L = Chl-a_ug/L X (1/1.1). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kbr3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aob6t","text":"(2) Verification of DNA and RNA standard concentrations ensures highly consistent assay results, facilitating comparisons of RNA and DNA data across researchers within the same group or across different groups. Below is an example showcasing the RNA and DNA values of Tripos obtained on different processing days, with sample replicates collected from various bottles. It's important to note that due to the large cell volume, cell counting of Tripos exhibits higher variation compared to small cells that can be counted using machines. This variation contributes to the standard deviation observed in RNA and DNA values.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea815","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"f1b7k","text":"Fold the filter with two tweezers:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asei7","text":"(1) Fold in half along its diameter, creating a semicircular shape; ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e82t","text":"(2) Fold once more in the same direction, resulting in a long strip; ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"933vr","text":"(3) Fold once more, halving its length, so that sample is secured.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fniom","text":"Place folded filter in 2 mL cryogenic vial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"5uvug","text":"No data is available addressing the mutagenicity or toxicity of SYBR® Green II Nucleic Acid Gel Stain. Because this reagent  binds to nucleic acids, it should be treated as a potential mutagen and used with appropriate care. The DMSO stock solution should be handled with particular caution as DMSO is known to facilitate the entry of organic molecules into tissues. We strongly recommend using double gloves when handling the DMSO stock solution. As with all nucleic acid stains, solutions of SYBR Green II Nucleic Acid Gel Stain should be poured through activated charcoal before disposal or collected in waste container to be treated later. The charcoal must then be incinerated to destroy the dye. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
